sec.p:
The N2015 core (35°28.205′N, 133°10.894′E) was taken from the central part of Lake Nakaumi at a depth of 6.3 m in 2015 by an air-pressured piston corer. The core was mostly composed of mud bearing shell fragments. The core sediments were cut into one-cm-thick slices and washed on a 63 µm opening sieve. Then, the residual materials were dried at room temperature. Eight samples of plant materials and molluscan shells were used for 14C dating (Supplementary Table S2). The age model was calculated by a cubic equation based on the median age of eight calculated 14C ages, suggesting that the age of the core dated back to BC 800 and deposition had been successive (Supplementary Fig. S2). An average marine reservoir age of 400 yrs was subtracted from each 14C age following the methods of Yamada et al.
19 and Ota et al.
53 .
